lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Nothing, I just like to go like this.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey Chandler, what are you doing tonight?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Uh why, do you have a lecture?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, why?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Then free as a bird. Whats up?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: My dad wanted to know if you wanted to play racquetball with us.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wow! Thats great! Dad must really like you, he doesnt ask just anyone to play.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah and he didnt really ask for you, he asked for Chancy, I assumed he meant you.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, did-did you correct him?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, I-I thought it would be more fun this way.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is so cool, maybe this is something you can do every week.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Or you can sit with him on the front porch and make sure no one steals the trash cans. He does that every week too.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh, just so you know, you-you have to let him win.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: He hates to lose.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh no problem, maybe Ill play with my left hand.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Youre not a lefty?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Does anybody know me?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Whats wrong Phoebe?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I just went to my old apartment to get you the-the cookie recipe and the stupid fire burned it up!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No!! Why didnt you make a copy and-and keep it in a fireproof box and keep it at least a hundred yards from the original?!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Because Im normal! That was the one legacy my grandmother left me, and I know you wanted it as an engagement present.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, we have to get you an engagement present?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Dont worry about it Pheebs.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No one got me an engagement present.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, here I wish you health and happiness.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: An old cookie?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: This is what happens when you dont register for gifts!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: See no-no, I made a batch and I froze it, and this is the only one left.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: We cant accept this.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Cause its gross.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No! Wait! I think I can figure out the recipe from this cookie! I do stuff like this at work all the time.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Really?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah! I bet I can do it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, we owe you a present.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Two! Ive been engaged twice!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Look at this clown! Just because hes got a bigger boat he thinks he can take up the whole river.  Get out of the way jackass!  Who names his boat Coast Guard anyway?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: That is the Coast Guard.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What are they doing out here? The coasts all the way over there.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey, just ignore the boats all right? Were not finished with the lesson yet.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, Im just gonna go over the basic points just one more time, are you ready?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Come on Rach, not again. I got it! Okay? Lets start sailing, and I want to go over there  where that boatload of girls is!  Yo-ho-ho!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, okay. Is that what you want to do? You wanna go over and give a little shout out to the old, hot chickas? Okay, lets do that Sailor Joe. Quick question though,  whats this called?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh, boat rope.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wrong! How do you get the mainsail up?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uhh, rub it?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No. What do you do if I say we are coming about?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Id say, come again. No-no, wait I-I-I know this one, I know this one, uh

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Times up, now your dead.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And deaf!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, you just go on and make your little jokey-jokes, but if you do not know what you are doing out at sea you will die at sea. Am I getting through to you sailor?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Dont just say yes! This isnt a game, Joey you can really get hurt out here. Okay, so do you want to pay attention or do you want to die?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I want to make a ship to shore call to Chandler.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: All right, I definitely taste nutmeg.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You do?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You dont?  Well, thats the difference between a professional and a layman.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: That and arrogance.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey! How was sailing?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I dont want to talk about it. Yknow, you couldve at least saved me a whole cookie.

lines.speaker: monica and phoebe
lines.text: No-wait-no-no!!!!!!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Women are mean!!!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I cant believe that! Now the only thing left of my grandmothers legacy is this crumb.  I wish you a long and happy marriage.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey! How was it?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well I had a great time! Umm, Chancy on the other hand

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I will tell the story! It was going great. I let him win. We were bonding. He even said I could call him dad.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: And what did he ask you not to call him?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Daddy. All right look, heres the story.  Well, we had just finished playing racquetball and we were gonna take a steam. I walk into the steam room and it was really steamy.  So I take off my glasses and thats when in happened.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Guys?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Over here.

lines.speaker: mr. geller
lines.text: Have a seat son.  Hey!!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oh my God Chandler! I cant believe it!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I know.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You gave my father a lap dance!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why do they put so much steam in there?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Cause otherwise theyd have to call it the room room.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why? Okay? Why? Wh-wh-why did that have to happen?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Come on, its not that big a deal!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Not that big a deal? There there was touching of things.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Now, I know you wanted to bond with my dad, but did you really have to bond to that part?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Listen, Im sure that dad doesnt care. He probably thought this was funny; hell be telling this story for years!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I dont want him to tell this story for years.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh, but he will. He still tells the story how Monica tried to escape from fat camp.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I wasnt escaping.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Then how did you get caught in the barbed wire?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I was trying to help out a squirrel.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You were trying to eat it!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: If that is your father calling to tell this story then the marriage is off!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Come on.  Hello?  Im sorry you have the wrong number.   Okay, Ill call you later dad. I love you.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: All right, Im off to see your dad.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Whoa-whoa, arent you a little over dressed?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, and-and you better make sure he tips you this time.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Look, I figured I would try to convince him not to tell the story anymore, and I figure the best way to do that is face to faceAnd by face I dont mean his lap. And by face, I dont mean my ass.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey are you getting Monica and Chandler an engagement present?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I dont know. Yknow, they didnt get us anything.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thank you!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well hello! So, when are we gettin back out on the water matey?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh uh, I dont know the boat way to say this, but uh never!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Because! Youre mean on the boat!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What? I was just trying to teach you.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, lesson learned! Rachel is mean!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeeeeeep Yep-yep-yep-yep-yep. I remember when she took out on her dads boat she wouldnt let me help at all.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Excuse me, I wanted you to help, but you couldnt move your arms because you were wearing three life jackets.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You have to respect the sea!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Look Joey, Im sorry if-if you thought that was mean, but I gotta tell ya something. That was not mean. Okay, my father is mean. He used to yell at me all the time on the boat, I mean it was horrible. I was just being a good teacher.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Does a good teacher say, "Put down the beer pinhead!?"

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, does a good student drink seven beers during his first lesson?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Six and a half! You knocked that last one out of my hand! Remember?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, I didnt want you to get hit by the boom!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well it hit me anyway! And it wouldve hurt a lot less if I had finished that last beer.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right, yknow what? I-Im sorry. I will try to tone it down and uh stop yelling.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You wont boss me around anymore?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I wont boss you around.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And youll be nice?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And, Ill be nice.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: And youll be topless?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: AndJoey!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Do you want me to learn?!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay, heres batch 22. Ohh, maybe thesell taste a little like your grandmothers. This has a little bit of orange peel, but no nutmeg.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Lets give it a shot.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay. Man, I have not made this many cookies since I was in the ninth grade.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, what was that for? Like a bake sale?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No, just a Friday night.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ohh, these are pretty good.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, but not as good as batch 17.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Which one was that?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: The ones we had right after you almost threw up.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh yeah! Batch 17 was good. I did not like batch 16.  Im okay.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Are there anymore from the good batch? Cause we could just work off of those.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, ooh yeah, I think there is one from batch 17 left, uh  Its batch 16! 16 people! Get out of the way!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay Joey honey, youre doing really good! All right, now Im just gonna need you to step to the port side.  Remember? Remember how we talked about the port side?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ohh yeah.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Right?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Nope.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Its left sweetie, but thats okay sweetie, thats a tough one.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I dont know why you just dont say left.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, go to the left.  The left!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Just sit over there!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay! Okay, youre yelling again! See that?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No! No-no, no-no-no, very quiet, said with love, no yelling.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, yknow what? Since Im here, I think Im gonna have me a little beer on the port side.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay Joey, were luffing a little bit, so could you tighten up the cunningham?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh, wow, you just said a bunch of stuff I didnt know there.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey, come on! We just went over this!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, yknow, when we did that was when that bird was flying overhead with the fish in his mouth. Did you see it? It was gross!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No! All right?! I did not see the bird! I did not see the fish! I did not see the piece of Styrofoam that was shaped like Mike Tyson! I did not, because I was trying to teach you how to sail a boat! Which obviously is an impossible thing to do!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right thats it! Youre yelling and I dont see you taking your top off! I quit!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What do you mean you quit?! You cant quit!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Why not?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Because youre not finished yet and I wont have it! Greens do not quit!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Greens? Im a Tribbiani! And Tribbianis quit!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God, wait did II just said Greens dont quit didnt I?   Did I just say Greens dont quit?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yes! Yes! You did and youre still yelling at me!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No! No! No! Im not yelling at you, Im just yelling near you. Oh God Joey, ohh Im my father. Oh my God, this is horrible! Ive been trying so hard not to be my mother I did not see this comin. Oh, Joey, Im sorry. Im so sorry. I just wanted you to learn.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, hey I did learn.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah! Come on.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Awww

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, its okay. I know what a mainsail is.  I know, I know to duck when the boom comes across. I-I know port is right.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Left.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Damnit!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yknow, I bet it would actually make my grandmother very happy to know that were trying to figure out her recipe. I bet shes l-l-lookin up at us and smiling right now.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Looking up?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh yeahNo, she was really nice to me, but shes in hell for sure.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, Ive tried everything. I give up. I guess Im not gonna be the mom who makes the worlds best chocolate cookies. I do make the best duck confit with broccoli rabe.  Kids love that right.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Aww, Pheeb, come on isnt there any relative that would have the recipe? What about, what about your sister?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh no-no, no, I made a promise to myself that the next time I would talk to Ursula would be over my dead body. And thats not happening til October 15th, 2032.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thats the day youre gonna die? Seedarnit, Ive got shuffleboard that day.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Thats what you think.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well, I mean what about friends of your grandmothers? Wouldnt they have the recipe?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, yknow I may have relatives in France who would know. My grandmother said she got the recipe from her grandmother, Nesele Tolouse.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What was her name?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Nesele Toulouse.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Nestle Tollhouse?!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, you Americans always butcher the French language.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe, is this the recipe?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes!!  Ohh.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I cannot believe that I just spent the last two days trying to figure out the recipe and it was in my cupboard the whole time!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I know! You see it is stuff like this which is why  youre burning in hell!!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So you understand, Id feel a lot more comfortable if you didnt tell people what happened. Yknow, Im a little Im a little embarrassed about it.

lines.speaker: mr. geller
lines.text: I understand completely, theres nothing more horrifying than embarrassing yourself in front of your in-laws. As a matter of fact, when I started dating Judy I was unemployed, and her father asked me what I did for a living and I told him I was a lawyer.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What did you do when they found out?

lines.speaker: mr. geller
lines.text: They never did, so if ever see me giving them legal advice just nod along. Shall we?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So I guess we wear swimsuits in here!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well Joey, I hate to admit it, your way of sailing is a lot more fun.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, yeah. Hey, why dont you give a pull on that rope?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ohh were not sailing.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Just pull on it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: All right.  Hey-hey-hey!!  Sandwiches!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What else?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Here you go.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh wow!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ohh, sorry.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What youdont hold it like that! Youre lettin all the good stuff fall out.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ohh whoops.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Careful! Youre wasting good pastrami!  Oh my God! Im my dad!

lines.speaker: mac
lines.text: Well, if we learned one thing today C.H.E.E.S.E. is that cheerleaders and high explosives dont mix.

lines.speaker: c.h.e.e.s.e
lines.text: You can say that again Mac.

lines.speaker: mac
lines.text: Well, I couldnt have done it without you buddy. Youre a genius.

lines.speaker: c.h.e.e.s.e
lines.text: Oh yeah? Well then how come I cant get my VCR to stop blinking 12:00?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: So, what did you guys think?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hello?  Hold on please. Joey, its your mom.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Its your mommy. Its your mommy.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ohhhh

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Thats nice.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Mom, so what did you think?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well that was umm Okay.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: It wasnt the best.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: That was one of the worse things ever. And not just on TV.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wh-what are we gonna tell him?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, the lighting was okay.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ohh no you dont! You got lighting last time, lighting is mine!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: And I have costumes.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh great! That means Im stuck with, "So, we were watching you in there  and you were sittin right here! Whoa!"

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What are you gonna do Pheebs?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I dont know. I dont know. I cant lie to him again. Oh no Ino! Im just gonna press my breasts up against him.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: And say nothing?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh, yeah thats right.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Wow! Well, my folks really liked it! So what-what did you guys think?  It wasnt that good.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe, do you think that your favorite animal says much about you?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What? You mean behind my back?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh! Hi you guys, oh my God! Youll never gonna believe happened to me today! I am sitting in my office and

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: You guys! You guys! Youre not gonna believe what my agent just told me!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey! Kinda in the middle of a story here!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ooh, sorry. Sorry. You finish, go.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, so anyway Im sittin in my office and guess who walks in.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Im gonna be on two TV shows!

lines.speaker: monica and phoebe
lines.text: Oh, thats great!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, you werent finished?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah! Guess who walks into my office is the end of my story.  It was Ralph Lauren!  Ralph Lauren walked into my office!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh Rach, if youre gonna start another story, at least let me finish mine.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Its the same story.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Wow, its really long.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Anyway, Ralph just came in to tell me that hes so happy with my work that he wants me to be the new merchandising manager for polo retail.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Still get a discount on wedding dresses?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Im so happy for you!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, these really are the days of our lives.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Well, since you ask. They want me back on Days of Our Lives!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh God!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I gotI get a big pay raise!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh hey!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ill be playing Drake Remorays twin brother, Stryker!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Oooh!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I get to hire my own assistant!

lines.speaker: monica and phoebe
lines.text: Ahhh!!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: WellI got a head rush from standing up to fast right there.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And you were at this job for four years?

lines.speaker: hilda
lines.text: Thats right.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, well this is all very impressive Hilda, um I just have one last question for you. Uh, how did I do? Was this okay?

lines.speaker: hilda
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ive never interviewed anyone before. Ive actually never had anyone work for me before. Although when I was a kid, we did have a maid, but this is-this isnt the same thing.

lines.speaker: hilda
lines.text: No dear. Its not.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No. Yeah, and I know that. All right, well thank you so much for coming in it was nice to meet you.

lines.text: So, Ross and I are going to Disneyland and we stop at this restaurant for tacos. And when I say restaurant, I mean a guy, a hibachi, and the trunk of his car. So Ross has about 10 tacos. And anyway, were on Space Mountain and Ross starts to feel a little iffy.

Now, I know what youre thinking, Chandlers not the type of guy who just goes to bars and makes out with girls, and youre right, Chandlers not the type of guy who just goes to bars and makes out with girls.

They canceled Mac and C.H.E.E.S.E!

lines.text: Look Joey, come on shes so perfect for you! I mean shes sweet, she- she likes baseball, and she-she had two beers at lunch.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, maybe if you gave this girl a chance it would go somewhere.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Look Im sorry you guys, I-I just dont think so.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Whatever.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Fine.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, dont start judging me!  Huh? Youre the one whos in love with her assistant!  Huh? And you, youre the one having the affair with the guy who keeps the pigeons on the roof!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Phoebe!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Secret affair!

lines.speaker: ross

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Im sorry?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: My doctoral dissertation is in the library at school, I went to see it, and there were students makin babies right in the middle of the Paleontology section!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God! Did you get to see anything good?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Let me ask you something, at your school was there a like uh a place on campus where students went to uh, fool around.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah, there was. It wasthere the corner of the library where-where all these dusty books that nobody ever readYes, there was.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Great! Because people kept showing up, I think its like uh-a thing!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Now hold on a second, fifth floor against that back wall?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh for cryin out loud!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right, so we should go catch our movie.

lines.text: Well now whats the rush?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: I like to see the previews.  The candy.

lines.text: Oh. Hey!

lines.text: Well look whos here!

lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: joey

lines.text: Hey Rachel.

lines.text: Hi! Well, we were just about to take off and see a movie. Oh no!

lines.text: Whats wrong?

lines.text: Oh Phoebe, we forgot that party we have to go to.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.text: What party?

lines.text: A birthday party.

lines.text: Whos birthday party?

lines.speaker: phoebe and rachel
lines.text: Allisons birthday party.

lines.text: Oh, and how is Allison?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wait a minute! Why dont you guys do something?!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah, look how that worked out.

lines.text: Excuse me. Hi, Im a professor here. Do you know the Paleontology section, fifth floor, stack 437?

lines.speaker: the librarian
lines.text: Well, yes! Just give me five minutes, I just have to find someone to cover my shift.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No! No!! No! Can I speak to someone in charge please?!

lines.speaker: the head librarian
lines.text: How can I help you?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hi, I was wondering if it is possible to increase security in the Paleontology section? See I-I wrote a book up there and instead of reading it people are-are-are well, rolling around in front of it.

lines.speaker: the head librarian
lines.text: We are aware of the problem you are referring too.  But as far as increasing security, Im afraid the library is very understaffed. I, I cant help you.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, fine. Fine! If-if Im the only person with any appreciation of the sanctity of the written word, Ill go up there and defend it myself!  And dont you follow me!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: How did it go with Erin?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh, unbelievable! We had the best time!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yay!! Oh so, youre not, youre not mad at us anymore?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: No! No! No! You guys were totally right! This is so much better than the first time we went out. Yknow? That was so awkward, we were really nervous.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Didnt you sleep together?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Yeah that really calms me down. And! We have so much in common! She loves sandwiches, sports, although she is a Met fan, not much of an issue now but if were ever to have kids, well thats a

lines.text: Oh my God! Listen to you talkin about having kids. Oh my Joey.  Oh, please dont get married before I do.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay.

lines.text: Oh. Oh I just cannot believe Clark stood me up!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: He might still show up.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh, what are you, stupid? Its been three hours.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Is that all?

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: I should just go on to happier things, okay? Umm, why dont you tell about your lovely wedding?

lines.text: Well actually uh, there was something we wanted to tell you about the wedding. Um, its going to be a small ceremony. Uh, tiny! Were not even sure why were having it.

lines.text: Its actually going to be just family.

lines.text: Oh wait you two think of me as family?! Oh, I have to ask you something now and be honest; do you want me to sing Careless Whisper or Lady In Red?

lines.text: How can you say that?! The Mets have no closer!

lines.text: What about Benitez?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What about Game 1 of the Series?

lines.text: What about shut up?

lines.text: You shut up!  I love arguing with her.  Ill be right back.

lines.text: Okay.

lines.text: So hows it goin with Joey?

lines.speaker: erin
lines.text: Uh, okay.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay? Wait okay, tell-tell me that you like him, please? I mean tell me that you like him.

lines.speaker: erin
lines.text: Look, hes a really great guy and I know that you really want this to work out, but I just dont see this having a future.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: But you said that you liked him! I mean what happened?! Did ya just change your mind?!

lines.speaker: erin
lines.text: Kinda.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Then change it back!

lines.speaker: erin
lines.text: Im sorry I Its just theres no real spark.

lines.speaker: erin
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Ugh, tramp!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Does Joey have any idea?

lines.speaker: erin
lines.text: I really dont think he does. And yknow what? Maybe you guys could help clue him in. Yknow, tell him Im-Im not interested in a serious relationship or something.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, you mean like that youre kind of a loner.

lines.speaker: erin
lines.text: Yeah! That would be great!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, and maybe that youre a real

lines.text: Im sorry?

lines.text: Hey, thank you so much.

lines.text: No, just a regular old flying dwarf.

lines.text: Yes? Yes?! How can I help you?

lines.text: Yeah, we were we were just looking around.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh-oh, youre-youre fellow scholars. What exactly were you looking for, hmm? Perhaps,  perhaps Dr. Chester Stocks musings on the Smiledon Californicus?

lines.speaker: guy
lines.text: Uhh .

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Ah Ah Get out of here!  Uh, meeting someone? Or-or are you just here to brush up on Marions views on evolution?

lines.text: Uh, actually I find Marions views far to progressionist.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I find Marions views far to progressionist.

lines.text: Im sorry, who are you?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Im a professor here uh, Ross Geller.

lines.speaker: woman
lines.text: Ross Geller, why do I know that name? Its uhWait!  Did you write this?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yes! Youre the person who checked out my book?!

lines.speaker: woman
lines.text: Yknow, you look nothing like I wouldve thought. Youre youre so young.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well I uh, I skipped forth grade.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I am very very sorry.

lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: Hey!

lines.text: Hi!

lines.text: Oh, it was great! I mean we walked all around the village. We went to this ice cream place, split a milkshake, 70/30 but still And guess what, Im thinking about taking her upstate to one of those bed and breakfasts.

lines.text: Oh really? She said she wants to go away with you?

lines.text: No-no-no-no-no! Its a surprise, but its gonna be tricky thought because she said she was gonna be pretty busy at work for a while.

lines.text: Oh no, yeah.

lines.text: Jo-Joey, look honey we-we need to talk okay? Umm, I kinda got the feeling from her today that uh, shes not lookin for a serious relationship.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh. Oh.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey

lines.text: Okay!

lines.text: Kinda like your Barca lounger.

lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Honestly? Our apartment is a hotbed for electromagnetic activity. Now Monica and I have been immunized, but sadly you have not.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Okay, Im going to need a comforter, but did you have a hypoallergenic one because otherwise I get very nasal.  Do you have a cat? Cause its already happening.  Do you hear that?

lines.text: Oh my God! Oh my God! You have to go!

lines.text: He does?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Say again?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Thats right. Thats right. And that is why you cant stay here tonight. And probably why you shouldnt come to the wedding.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Feelings, such strong feelings.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: I mean, I realize that his feelings may never completely go away, but you can.

lines.speaker: janice
lines.text: Oh my Gawd, I-I understand. I-I am so sorry, Ill go.  Good-bye Monica , I wish you a lifetime of happiness with him. Chandler,  you call me when this goes in the pooper.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Dont sweat it, Ive got this section covered. Yeah, in fact Ive got this little baby  to shine in peoples eyeOkay, see you later.

lines.text: I just wanted to show Monica your book.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No, no, no. No-no-no.

lines.text: No, we're playing this game I learned at work. You have to name all the states in six minutes.

lines.text: What? That's like insanely easy!

lines.text: Now, that's a lot harder than it sounds. You always forget at least one, or in some cases... fourteen .

lines.text: It's a stupid game and I wasn't playing against other people, so technically I didn't lose.

lines.text: Oh, okay, time's up!

lines.text: All right, I got 48.

lines.text: Okay, so Rachel's got 48 and Phoebe has the lead in vegetables, Joey?

lines.text: Say hello to the new champ of Chandler's dumb states game.

lines.text: Wow, how many have you got?

lines.text: Hey! How is New England not a state? Huh? They have a sports-team!

lines.text: Does South Oregon have a sports-team?  There you go.

lines.text: 'Cause you invited your assistant.

lines.text: Oh, right. Sorry. But Tag's not coming; his girlfriend came into town, so he's spending Thanksgiving with her.

lines.text: Oh! Why didn't you tell me? I made him his own individual sweet potato stuffed pumpkin.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Well, I was going to, but then I figured, you know... you're food is so delicious and perfect, you can never have too many of those pumpkin things.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Now you think I wouldn't enjoy that, because it is so fake,  but I still do.

lines.text: Regular Celery!  Oh, I already have that.

lines.speaker: ross

lines.text: Oooh that may be a New World's record

lines.text: You know, I hate to lecture you guys, but it's kinda disgraceful, that a group of well-educated adults and Joey can't name all the states. Did you ever see a map, or one of those round, colorful things called "a globe?" Hmm?

lines.text: Uh, Magellan? You got 46 states.

lines.text: What? That's impossible.

lines.text: 46\. Wow! Who's well educated now, Mr. I-forgot-ten-states?

lines.text: All right, I'm out of oven space. I'm gonna turn on Joey's. Please, watch him! Do not let Joey eat any of the food!

lines.text: I am only one man!  Okay Ross, time is up!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, just give me another minute.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Look Ross, if you don't know them by now, you will never know them, okay? That is the beauty of this game. It makes you want to kill yourself.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: This-this is crazy! I can do this! All right, uhh, I bet I can get all 50 before dinner.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, but if you can't no dinner!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You're on!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right. Don't look at my list, Ross, 'cause there's a lot on there that you don't have.

lines.text: Hey, did you guys know, that your oven doesn't work?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: But the drawer full of take-out menus is okay, right?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Ross, I'm gonna use yours, okay?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Pshhshhh!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Chandler? Can you give me a hand?

lines.text: Sure, and Joey; do not let Ross look at any of the maps or the globe in your apartment.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Don't worry, Chandler, it's not a globe of the United States.

lines.text: Hey you guys I'm gonna go out and take a walk.

lines.text: Oh, it's not!

lines.text: Seriously, it's moving!

lines.text: What the hell is in there?

lines.text: It's just my knitting that's all!  Yes! I knit this. I'm very good.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Rosss apartment is nice! How come we don't hang out here more often?

lines.text: I don't know. Maybe it's because it smells a little weird. It's like old pumpkins or something.

lines.text: That's my pie!

lines.text: Which smells delicious!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Uh-oh! Uh-oh!

lines.text: What?

lines.text: We left Joey alone with the food!  Yep! Yep, I knew it! There he is... feeding stuffing to a dog!

lines.text: Yes there is! He's black and white and shaggy and  he's sitting next to Rachel and licking Rachel's hand.

lines.text: Oh my god! Where are you?

lines.text: I'll be right there!

lines.text: Well, sure! Come in!  Well, what-what happened to your girlfriend?

lines.text: We kinda broke up this morning.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry.

lines.text: Yeah, so she went back to Ohio.

lines.text: Ohio!! Thank you!

lines.text: Huh! Where is the dog?!

lines.text: Phoebe! Phoebe, open up!

lines.text: There's no dog in here.

lines.text: Phoebe, we can hear the dog barking!

lines.text: No that's just me coughing!  Oh, good, there you are! Listen, um, I have a dog in my room.

lines.text: What is it doing here?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, I'm watching it for some friends who went out of town. Wait.  Hello, my name is Clunkers. May I please stay with you nice people?

lines.text: Oooh, I wish she could stay here, but Chandler is allergic!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Extremely allergic, okay? If I'm anywhere near a dog for more than 5 minutes, my throat will just close up!

lines.text: That's odd, 'cause this dog's been living here for the past 3 days

lines.speaker: chandler

lines.text: Chandler, if that dog's been here that long, and you haven't had a reaction, maybe you're not allergic to this dog?

lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Okay, it's um

lines.text: Don't do it!

lines.text: Don't do what?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I have to! Okay? It's time!  Okay, I hate dogs.

lines.text: What?

lines.text: Are you crazy?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Are you out of your mind?

lines.text: Oh, it's so much more fun with you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: We did have fun, didn't we?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: We did!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, anyway, they say, if we want, we can see it tonight.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, I would love to!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yay, okay!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Good, good, good, good, good.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Great, all right, okay, and Monica ask me to make the drumming stop.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Um...  Done!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: salesman
lines.text: Hello, Sir. You're here to return those pants?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No, these are my pants.

lines.speaker: salesman
lines.text: Oh. Okay! How can I help you?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well, uh, do you have a Santa-outfit left?

lines.speaker: salesman
lines.text: Two days before Christmas? Sorry, man.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay look, do-do, you have anything Christmassy? I promised my son, and I really don't want to disappoint him, um, come on, I uh, you gotta have something.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I'm the holiday armadillo! I'm a friend of Santa's and he sent me here to wish you  a Merry Christmas!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What happened to Santa, Holiday Armadillo?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Santa was unavailable so close to Christmas.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wow, come in, have a seat. You must be exhausted coming all the way from Texas.

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Texas?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: That's right, Ben. I'm Santa's representative for all the southern states. And Mexico! But, Santa sent me here to give you these presents, Ben.  Maybe the Lady will help me with these presents.

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Wow! Thanks!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You're welcome, Ben. Merry Christmas, ooh, and Happy Hanukkah!

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Are you for Hanukkah, too? Because I'm part-Jewish.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You are? Me, too!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Because Armadillos also wandered in the desert?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: You wanna wander in the hall?  Ooh, hey Ben, what if the Holiday Armadillo told you all about the festival of lights?

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Cool!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Come on Ben.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Years and years ago there were these people called the Maccabees...

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ho, ho, ho! Merry Christmas!

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Santa!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What are you doing here, Santa?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I'm here to see my old buddy Ben. What are you doing here, weird turtle-man?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I'm the Holiday Armadillo, your part-Jewish friend. You sent me here to give Ben some presents. Remember?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Did you bring me any presents, Santa?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You bet I did, Ben, put it there!   Well, it would have worked this time, if his hands weren't so damn small!  Ho, ho, ho!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Okay Ben, why don't you come open some more presents, and Santa, the Armadillo, and I have a little talk in the kitchen? There's a sentence, I never thought I'd say.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: You called everyone and said you were having trouble finding a Santa costume, so I borrowed one from a guy at work!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thank you, but, but you gotta leave.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Because, I'm finally getting him excited about Hanukkah, and, and you're-youre wrecking it.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: But I didn't get to shape my belly like a bowl full of jelly.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: I'm sorry, Chandler but this, this is really important to me.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Fine, I'll give the suit back.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey, you think, you can keep it another night?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Santa? Really?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yes, is that okay?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Did your Dad ever dress up like Santa?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Then it's okay!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay Ben, Santa has to go. Say good-bye!

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: No! Why does he have to go?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Because, if Santa and the Holiday Armadillo?  ...are ever in the same room for too long the universe will implode. Merry Christmas!

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: No! Why can't the Armadillo leave? I want Santa!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Fine, I-I give up. Santa, Santa can stay.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, I'll stay, but only because I wanna hear about Hanukkah. Ben, will you sit here with Santa and learn about Hanukkah?

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Okay, Santa!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: All right, it's time for the story of Hanukkah. Years and years ago, there were these people called the Maccabees.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Merry Christmas!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh wow! Look at this place!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, this is terrible. Oh, theyve made so many changes I cant even feel my grandmothers presence anymoreOoh! New sconces!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Okay, remember uh, remember how you told me that your grandmother put up that wall to make that into two bedrooms?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: And remember how you always said you were afraid the landlord would find out and then tear it down?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Do you really not know where Im going with this?  It left! Its one huge room!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh no!   Oh! Wow!!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: See?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, I guess well just have to put the wall back up.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: You cant, because of the new skylight!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Theres a skylight?!  Wow!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So what should we do? Should we start looking for a new place?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yknow Im-Im sensing that um, my grandmother would not be comfortable with that.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh yeah? Startin to feel her again there are we?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: A little bit, yeah.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Pheebs is your grandmother maybe saying that you should live here alone?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: You heard her too?! You have the gift!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Phoebe, its okay. I like living with Joey.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Are you sure?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh please, I hate packing, its closer to work, and we do have fun. Although, Im really gonna miss living with you.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh me too.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I know.  Oh-oh, wait did you hear that-hear that? Listen, Im gettin something from your grandmother, she said that since you get to keep the one bedroom apartment you should give Rachel the purple chair?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No, I do not hear that.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: and the miracle was that that little bit of oil that shouldve just lasted just one day, burned for

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Eight whole days.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thats right, and thats why we celebrate Hanukkah today. The end.

lines.speaker: ben
lines.text: Awesome!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: My favorite part was when Superman flew all the Jews out of Egypt.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: The Armadillo was actually not so thrilled about that part! Okay Ben, its time to light the Hanukkah candles!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Wow! It looks like the Easter Bunnys funeral in here.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Come on, come on, were-were-were lighting the candles!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, I understand why Superman is here, but why is there a porcupine at the Easter Bunnys funeral?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: I got it!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Is it back in the cage?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Its back in cage!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Cage closed?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Joey, would you just come out here and stop being such a baby!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ohh. Mmm.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Hey, you have got to try this cheesecake.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, yknow I'm not that much of a sweet tooth. IWow. My God, so creamy. Oh my God, this is the best cheesecake I have ever had. Where did you get this?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: It was at the front door. When I got home. Somebody sent it to us.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler, this is not addressed to you. This is addressed to Mrs. Braverman downstairs.  Thief.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Ino! I didn't read the box before I opened it. And you can't return a box after you've opened the box.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Why, why not?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Because it's too delicious.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Chandler, you stole this cheesecake. That is wrong.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: No-no-no! It is going to be okay, because Mrs. Braverman is gonna send away for a free one and that way we all win! The only losers are the big cheesecake conglomerate,  Mommas Little Bakery.  I feel terrible, Im a horrible, horrible, horrible person.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh, Im sorry what?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: All right, I should get going, big day a work. Yknow Im in a coma? Today, they do this test on me and it turns out Im not brain dead.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ah-ah-ah Mr. Smartie Pants, its just not my character thats not brain dead. Hey, so Pheebs, we still on for tonight?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Absolutely!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Ill see you at 8:00.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh, whats at 8:00?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, I have dinner plans with Joey. We get together about once a month to discuss the rest of you guys.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Wow, did not know that! May I say how lovely you look today?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Duly noted.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Thanks.   Oh! So for tomorrow, do you want to rent a car and drive down together or what?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Cousin Frannies wedding, its tomorrow night.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: You were invited?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: My God, I cant believe this! I mean I knew that mom and dad were invited, but I thought that was it! I mean from the ages 7 to 9 Frannie and I were inseparable!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, maybe since the age of 9, Frannies made some new friends.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well l-look okay, its probably just a mistake. Let me call Aunt Sheryl okay? Maybe you are invited and the invitation just got lost in the mail.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Yeah, well you call her and tell her that yknow when we were kids her precious little Frannie tried to undress me several times, okay? And if I hadnt have stopped her, there probably wouldnt even be a wedding to go too.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yknow, she tried to undress me too.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I used to undress my cousin Glenn.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Joseph Francis Tribbiani are you home yet?!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Umm, I think hes still out. Whats wrong?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, Ill tell you Rachel Karen Green, I had plans with Joey tonight and he left me this note.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: "Pheebs, cant make it, got a date. Talk to you later. Big Daddy."  Big Daddy?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh thats a nickname we were trying out.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey, yknow what nickname never caught on? The Ross-A-Tron!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh! Heres Joseph Francis!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh-Wha-Ho! What are you middle naming me for?! I left you a note!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: So what?! That doesnt give you the right to ditch me!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey, you can cancel plans with friends if there is the possibility for sex!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Phoebe hes right, that is the rule.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I dont accept this rule. When me make plans, I expect you to show up. Okay, I cant just be a way to kill time til you meet someone better! Yknow boyfriends and girlfriends come and go, but this  is for life!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Wow! Im so sorry; I had no idea it would bother you this much.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, it does.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Okay, can I-can I make it up to you? Huh? Im sorry.  How about uh, dinner tomorrow night?! Ill pay for myself!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Okay, you wore me down.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey Joe, while youre over there how about another beer for the Ross-A- Tron?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: The RossIs that back?!!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Another cheesecake came! They delivered it to the wrong address again!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: So just bring it back downstairs, whats the problem?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: I cant seem to say goodbye.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Are you serious?! Chandler, we ate an entire cheesecake two days ago and you want more?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well Ive forgotten what it tastes like okay?!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: It was cheesecake. It was fine. It had a buttery, crumbly, graham cracker crust, with a very rich yet light, cream cheese filling  Wow! My whole mouth just filled with saliva!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Yknow what? Forget it! We are just hungry! We have not had lunch! We are just light-headed! So let us go out and have lunch and forget about the cheesecake.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Yeah and well drop it off downstairs so that were not tempted.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Good idea. Where do you want to go to lunch?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Mommas Little Bakery, Chicago, Illinois.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Awww! Mel Torme died.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Joey, that papers like a year old!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Aw! Does that mean the Sam Goodys sale is over?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: So I finally heard back from Aunt Sheryl and apparently it wasnt a mistake. Ahh, theres-theres limited seating in the hall.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Limited seating?!  I am just one tiny person!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Well yeah, but she doesnt know that. I mean, the last time she saw you- you wouldve turned one of those little wedding chairs into kindling.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Limited seating! Oh, that is such a lame excuse! Thats not the reason shes not inviting me!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh whats the big deal?! I wasnt even invited to the ceremony, just the reception. And-and yknow what? If it makes you feel any better, Joan and I will just make an appearance and then, and then well-well leave early as a sign of protest.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Joan?

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Yeah, Joan Tedeski my date. Shes an assistant professor in the Linguistics department. Tall, very beautiful, and despite what some people say, not broad backed!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wait a minute, you got Ross Gellar and guest?! I wasnt invited and you got "and guest?!"

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Uh-uh, excuse me, I do have to interrupt on Rosss behalf. I-I think the rule applies here yknow, since she has a chance to get on broad back

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Not broad backed!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Wait a minute, yknow, youre bringing me!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: What? I cant cancel on Joan!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Why not?!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: BecDid you not hear me?! Shes an assistant professor in the Linguistics department, okay? Theyre wild! Why do you want to come anyway?

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Because! Shes my cousin. I mean, we grew up together! Were family yknow? Well thats important to me.

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Okay, all right, Ill take you. Ill go call Joan.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Aww thats nice. Family should be there, huh? This is her wedding, happiest day of her life.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Well see.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, thank you for lunch.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: What? Wait a minute, I didnt pay, I thought you paid!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: So apparently we just dont pay for food anymore.  Do you see what I see?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Its still there!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Mrs. Braverman must be out.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: She could be out of town. Maybe shell be gone for months.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: By then, the cheesecake may have gone bad. We dont want her to come back to bad cheesecake.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No that could kill her.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Well, we dont want that.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: No so were protecting her.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: But we should take it.

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: But we should move quick.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Why?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Because I think I just heard her moving around in there.

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go! Go!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh my God! Thats David!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: David who?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: David the scientist guy, David that I was in love with, David who went to Russia and broke my heart David!

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: Oh my God!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Oh, you say someones name enough, they turn around.

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: Phoebe?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: David!  What-what are you doing here? Arent you supposed to be in Russia?

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: Yeah, Im just, Im just in town for a conference. Umm, God you look phenomenal!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well Yeah. You look great too. Did you get a haircut?

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: Yeah. Well I-I got like thirty of them.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: Umm, look I-I-I got a confession to make

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: Uh, I-I-I was hoping to run into you here. I didnt know whether I should call or not, yknow I-I was only in town for a few days. And yknow, I didnt want to intrude on your life or-or anything like that, but I-I really wanted to see you andbut I didnt know if you wanted to see me.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, of course I would want to see you. I I think about you all the time.

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: Really? Because I think about you all the time.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: I mean, theres a statue in Minsk

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: That reminds me of you so much, I mean umm, it-its actually of Lenin. But, yknow at certain angles

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: Umm, anyway Do you want to have dinner tonight?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Yes! Oh no!

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: Oh. Uh, what?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: I cant. I cant believe I have plans, I cant. Can you do it tomorrow night though?

lines.speaker: david
lines.text: Uh no, I have to go in a few hours. I have to be on the red-eye. Well listen, yknow, next time youre in Minsk umm

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Phoebe, can I talk to you for a second?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Uh-huh.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Well, I have plans with Joey tonight.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: So! Hell understand!

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: No he wont. And thats not even the point! Monica, I made a whole speech about you do not cancel plans with friends! And now yknow what? Just because, potentially, the love of my life comes back from Russia just for one night, I-I should change my beliefs?! I should change beliefs! No! No! No, if I dont have my principles, I dont have anything!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: God, you are so strong.

lines.speaker: phoebe
lines.text: Or! I should rush through dinner with Joey and I can meet David at 9:00!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh my God! That is so good!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Im full, and yet I know if I stop eating this, Ill regret it.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What do you got there?

lines.speaker: rachel
lines.text: Oh its umm, its tofu cake. Do you want some?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: What are you doing tonight?

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Huh? Uh

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Dude! Dude!

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: Oh!  Sorry. Uh, Ive got those plans with Phoebe, why?

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Oh really? Uh, Monica said she had a date at 9:00.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: What?! Tonight?!

lines.speaker: chandler
lines.text: Thats what Monica said.

lines.speaker: joey
lines.text: After she gave me that big speech?! She goes and makes a date with a guy on the same night she has plans with me? I think shes trying to pull a fast one on Big Daddy!

lines.speaker: ross
lines.text: Oh here, I think this is us.  Yeah.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Limited seating my ass. Lets see who made the cut.  Hi!

lines.speaker: the wedding guest
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Im Monica Gellar. Who do you know the bride and groom?

lines.speaker: the wedding guest
lines.text: Oh, I used to work with Frannie.

lines.speaker: monica
lines.text: Used to work with her. Used to! Im a relative and I didnt get invited! A blood relative! Blood!!

lines.text: Terrific! Well uh, theres one more thing. Uhh, uh its really important to the director that everything in this movie is authentic. Yeah and so in your love scene with Sarah she talks about how shes never seen a naked man who wasnt Jewish. So

lines.text: Okay. Okay. All right, you take care of that. And meanwhile, the party is tomorrow and we still dont have a guest list.

She was the one who suggested opening a bottle of wine. She was the one who turned down the lights. She was the one that wanted to rent Logans Run, the sexiest movie ever.  Oh, I know that look. Forget it. I want it. She wants it. Im going in.

There is nothing you can say to make this worse!! So just say something!!   I-I, I uh havent had sex in a very long time.   Yeah, you really shouldnt have said anything.

lines.speaker: {transcribers note
lines.text: She puts the key into the ignition, which is on the left side of the steering wheel. Does anyone know why that is? Its a tradition left over from Porsches racing history. The worlds greatest endurance race is the 24 Hours of LeMans. Which is in France and runs for 24 hours straight from noon on Saturday through the dark of night and finishes at noon on Sunday.  In the 60s LeMans had a unique start where the drivers would actually start the race outside of the car and across the track. At the start of the race, the drivers would run across the track, get in the car, buckle up, start the car, and drive off. Porsche wanted to reduce the amount of time that took. Since all cars to that point had the ignition switches on the right side of the steering wheel, that required the drivers to use their right hand to grab the seat-belts, put the car in gear and start it. The drivers left hand did nothing. Porsche in order to save a few seconds in a 24-hour race; moved the ignition switches to the left side of the steering wheel so that the driver could start the car with his left hand while grabbing the seat-belts with his right hand. Thats why every Porsche car built since then has the ignition on the left side of the steering wheel.}
